body.p: When you use to configure settings for virtual machines, you can select an experience level for the user interface. The following experience levels are available:

li.p: Basic. Only a limited number of settings and tools are shown. Wizards are used to display configuration options. This is the default setting.
This level is suitable for a first time user of .
Expert. All available settings and tools are shown.
Tabbed displays rather than wizards are used for configuration options.
This level is suitable for an experienced user who needs more control of virtual machine settings.

body.p: Experience levels can be configured in the following places in :

note.p: The option disappears from the Welcome screen, after you have selected it.

li.p: The Settings window for a virtual machine.

body.p: Wherever you set it, the preference applies throughout .

ol.li: In the File menu, choose Preferences.

li.p: Click Basic or Expert to select the required experience level.

image.alt: Icon for setting the experience level. Click to enable Basic or Expert mode.
Icon for setting the experience level. Click to enable Basic or Expert mode.

li.p: The number of available settings and tools will change, depending on the selected experience level.
